Preset parameters for the analysis

Source: R/analysis_params.R
analysis_params.Rd

Dataset containing the preset parameters that are needed for the analysis as a list. The parameters correspond to the values of the paper.

analysis_params

Format

A large list with 18 elements:

trial_size_per_participant

numeric, number of erotic trials performed by participants in the study (if no missing trials)

m0_prob

numeric, probability of success if M0 is true

when_to_check

integer, interim analysis points (in total number of ONLY EROTIC trials performed)

inference_threshold_bf_high

numeric, threshold to infer support for M0 (high)

inference_threshold_bf_low

numeric, threshold to infer support for M1 (low)

y_prior

integer, number of successes in erotic trials in Bem's experiment 1

n_prior

integer, number of erotic trials in Bem's experiment 1

minimum_effect_threshold_nhst

numeric, smallest effect size of interest in the NHST equivalence test

inference_threshold_robustness_nhst

numeric, p threshold for the NHST proportion test robustness test

minimum_effect_threshold_bayes_par_est

numeric

scale

numeric

inference_threshold_robustness_bayes_par_est

numeric, threshold to set the HDI width to check against the ROPE

rope

numeric

sim_null_participant_num

integer, number of participants to sample from a population with H0 success rate

success_proportions_theoretical

numeric, the theoretical sample that approximates the theoretical null model

inference_threshold_nhst

numeric, p threshold for the NHST tests

p_equiv_test

numeric, p for the equivalence test

success_proportions_theoretical

numeric, samples 1,000,000 participants from a population with a 50% successful guess chance

Contents
